title: Who will remain when everything collapses?
teaser: Systems are failing. Networks scatter. But covenant people stay. These are your people. And you are theirs.
framework: Matthew 6:33 - Seek first the kingdom... and all these things will be added

panels.heading: AFTER THE COLLAPSE
panels.content:
You started this week asking: Who are your people when systems fail?

The systems are still failing. 71% are still dissatisfied with democracy. Institutions are still collapsing. Loneliness is still epidemic.

The ground is still shaking.

But something has changed: **You know who stays.**

Not your network. Not your contacts. Not the people who valued you for what you could offer.

Your covenant people. The ones who show up at 2 a.m. The ones who pool resources when you're broke. The ones who sit with you when you're falling apart.

When everything collapses, **they remain.**

panels.heading: WHAT SURVIVES THE SHAKING
panels.content:
There's an ancient image for this: the refining fire.

Gold goes into the furnace mixed with impurities. The fire burns hot. Everything unstable melts away. What's left? **Pure gold.**

Your relationships have been in the fire this week.

The transactional connections, the shallow networks, the conditional friendships—they've melted away.

What remains?

**Covenant. The people who stay when it costs them something.**

Not because you're useful. Not because you're winning. Because you're **theirs** and they're **yours.**

That's what survives the shaking. That's what's real.

Covenant people. Bound by something stronger than transaction.

panels.heading: WHAT YOU CARRY FORWARD
panels.content:
So who will remain when everything collapses?

You'll still live in 2026. Systems will still fail. Democracy will still fracture. Loneliness will still be epidemic.

But you'll carry something different: **a community that doesn't scatter.**

When the economy crashes, your people will pool rent. When institutions fail, your people will create mutual aid. When isolation crushes others, your people will gather around the table.

Because you're not in a network anymore. You're in a covenant.

And covenant doesn't depend on systems being stable. It depends on people staying faithful.

That's the kingdom community. It survives collapse.

Because it's built on something unshakeable: **mutual, self-giving love.**

illustration.description: Dithered image of people standing together in storm, or strong roots intertwined underground

panels.heading: JESUS SENDS YOU OUT—TOGETHER
panels.content:
At the end of his time on earth, Jesus didn't send individuals out alone. He sent them **in pairs. In groups. Together.**

He said:

**"As the Father has sent me, I am sending you... Receive the Holy Spirit."**

Not: Go be self-sufficient heroes.

But: **Go together. Carry each other. Be covenant people in a collapsing world.**

You're not meant to face empire alone. You're not meant to survive crisis in isolation. You're meant to be part of a community that stays.

Jesus sends you out—but not solo.

He sends you with your people.

The ones who remain when systems fail.

panels.heading: SEEK FIRST THE KINGDOM
panels.content:
You started this journey asking who your people are. You end it knowing.

Jesus said: **"Seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you."**

The kingdom isn't isolated individuals climbing ladders. It's covenant people gathered around tables.

When you seek that first—when you prioritize **covenant over network, presence over performance, mutual aid over transaction**—everything else finds its place.

Not because systems stabilize. But because **you have people who stay when systems collapse.**

That's the kingdom. That's your community.

And it's unshakeable.

Because it's not built on what fails. It's built on who remains.

panels.heading: THE SENDING
panels.content:
God,

When I asked who my people were, You showed me.

Not my network. Not my contacts. My covenant family.

The ones who stay when I'm no longer useful. The ones who show up when it costs something. The ones who remain when everything collapses.

I'm not the same as I was five days ago.

Systems are still failing. But I have people now. Real people. Covenant people.

Send us out together.

Not to build empires. But to be Your presence in a collapsing world.

Where two or three gather, You are there.

We're gathering. Stay with us.

Amen.
